sections.title: I am the Lord your God; you shall not have strange gods before me

questions.text: Have I placed my ministry or reputation above God's will?
Have I trusted more in my own effort than in divine grace?
Have I remained faithful to daily prayer and adoration?
Have I put distractions before intimacy with God?
Have I shown reverence for God's presence in the Blessed Sacrament?
Have I prayed with the community even when I didn’t feel like it?
Have I renewed my 'yes' to God's call with joy?

sections.title: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain

questions.text: Have I used God's name casually or in frustration?
Have I spoken disrespectfully about sacred things?
Have I remained silent when God’s name was misused?
Have I invoked God’s name in vain promises?
Have I remembered the holiness of my religious habit and title?
Have I spoken about God with love and reverence?
Have I prayed with attention and care?

sections.title: Remember to keep holy the Lord’s Day

questions.text: Have I honored the Sabbath with joyful reverence?
Have I celebrated the liturgy with full attention and love?
Have I refrained from unnecessary work on Sundays?
Have I encouraged others to rest and worship well?
Have I made Sunday a true day of community, prayer, and peace?
Have I avoided treating Sunday like every other day?
Have I given thanks each Lord's Day for my vocation?

sections.title: Honor your father and your mother

questions.text: Have I prayed for my parents and family with love?
Have I been grateful for the sacrifices made for my vocation?
Have I spoken respectfully of Church leaders and superiors?
Have I honored the wisdom of my religious founders?
Have I encouraged others to honor their families?
Have I accepted authority with humility?
Have I thanked God for my spiritual family?
Have I harmed others through gossip or harsh words?
Have I nurtured anger or resentment toward those I serve?
Have I forgiven offenses quickly and sincerely?
Have I defended the dignity of life from conception to death?
Have I made time to be present with those who are suffering?
Have I avoided emotional withdrawal in conflict?
Have I promoted peace in my heart and community?
Have I honored my vow of chastity with joy and vigilance?
Have I kept my heart undivided in service to Christ?
Have I avoided situations or media that compromise purity?
Have I modeled holy and respectful relationships?
Have I been faithful in thought and desire as well as action?
Have I sought healing and confession when impure?
Have I supported others in living chaste lives?
Have I respected community property and resources?
Have I taken more than my share of time or attention?
Have I been transparent with personal and communal stewardship?
Have I wasted resources or failed to care for shared goods?
Have I used others’ ideas or work without credit?
Have I spent community funds or time without proper discretion?
Have I taught and lived simplicity and generosity?

sections.title: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor

questions.text: Have I spoken truthfully about others in all circumstances?
Have I avoided gossip, even under the guise of concern?
Have I protected the good name of others?
Have I apologized when I have misrepresented the truth?
Have I taught truth with charity and clarity?
Have I corrected misinformation when I could?
Have I asked God to purify my speech and silence?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife

questions.text: Have I been jealous of others' relationships or vocations?
Have I fostered emotional dependency or spiritual possessiveness?
Have I kept appropriate and healthy boundaries in relationships?
Have I turned to God with my longings and loneliness?
Have I remembered that only Christ satisfies the heart?
Have I rejoiced in others' companionship without envy?
Have I loved freely and chastely without attachment?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods

questions.text: Have I envied the success, roles, or gifts of others?
Have I been discontent with my assignments or resources?
Have I been greedy for attention, comfort, or recognition?
Have I thanked God for the simplicity of my calling?
Have I delighted in the spiritual gifts of others?
Have I let comparison steal my joy in service?
Have I praised God for all He has provided?
